content.text:
--- name: gog description: Google Workspace CLI for Gmail, Calendar, Drive, Contacts, Sheets, and Docs. homepage: https://gogcli.sh metadata: {"openclaw":{"emoji":"üéÆ","requires":{"bins":["gog"]},"install":[{"id":"brew","kind":"brew","formula":"steipete/tap/gogcli","bins":["gog"],"label":"Install gog (brew)"}]}} --- # gog Use `gog` for Gmail/Calendar/Drive/Contacts/Sheets/Docs. Requires OAuth setup. Setup (once) - `gog auth credentials /path/to/client_secret.json` - `gog auth add you@gmail.com --services gmail,calendar,drive,contacts,docs,sheets` - `gog auth list` Common commands - Gmail search: `gog gmail search 'newer_than:7d' --max 10` - Gmail messages search (per email, ignores threading): `gog gmail messages search "in:inbox from:ryanair.com" --max 20 --account you@example.com` - Gmail send (plain): `gog gmail send --to a@b.com --subject "Hi" --body "Hello"` - Gmail send (multi-line): `gog gmail send --to a@b.com --subject "Hi" --body-file ./message.txt` - Gmail send (stdin): `gog gmail send --to a@b.com --subject "Hi" --body-file -` - Gmail send (HTML): `gog gmail send --to a@b.com --subject "Hi" --body-html "

Hello

"` - Gmail draft: `gog gmail drafts create --to a@b.com --subject "Hi" --body-file ./message.txt` - Gmail send draft: `gog gmail drafts send ` - Gmail reply: `gog gmail send --to a@b.com --subject "Re: Hi" --body "Reply" --reply-to-message-id ` - Calendar list events: `gog calendar events --from --to ` - Calendar create event: `gog calendar create --summary "Title" --from --to ` - Calendar create with color: `gog calendar create --summary "Title" --from --to --event-color 7` - Calendar update event: `gog calendar update --summary "New Title" --event-color 4` - Calendar show colors: `gog calendar colors` - Drive search: `gog drive search "query" --max 10` - Contacts: `gog contacts list --max 20` - Sheets get: `gog sheets get "Tab!A1:D10" --json` - Sheets update: `gog sheets update "Tab!A1:B2" --values-json '[["A","B"],["1","2"]]' --input USER_ENTERED` - Sheets append: `gog sheets append "Tab!A:C" --values-json '[["x","y","z"]]' --insert INSERT_ROWS` - Sheets clear: `gog sheets clear "Tab!A2:Z"` - Sheets metadata: `gog sheets metadata --json` - Docs export: `gog docs export --format txt --out /tmp/doc.txt` - Docs cat: `gog docs cat ` Calendar Colors - Use `gog calendar colors` to see all available event colors (IDs 1-11) - Add colors to events with `--event-color ` flag - Event color IDs (from `gog calendar colors` output): - 1: #a4bdfc - 2: #7ae7bf - 3: #dbadff - 4: #ff887c - 5: #fbd75b - 6: #ffb878 - 7: #46d6db - 8: #e1e1e1 - 9: #5484ed - 10: #51b749 - 11: #dc2127 Email Formatting - Prefer plain text. Use `--body-file` for multi-paragraph messages (or `--body-file -` for stdin). - Same `--body-file` pattern works for drafts and replies. - `--body` does not unescape `\n`. If you need inline newlines, use a heredoc or `$'Line 1\n\nLine 2'`. - Use `--body-html` only when you need rich formatting. - HTML tags: `

` for paragraphs, `
` for line breaks, `` for bold, `` for italic, `` for links, `

    `/`
  • ` for lists. - Example (plain text via stdin): ```bash gog gmail send --to recipient@example.com \ --subject "Meeting Follow-up" \ --body-file - <<'EOF' Hi Name, Thanks for meeting today. Next steps: - Item one - Item two Best regards, Your Name EOF ``` - Example (HTML list): ```bash gog gmail send --to recipient@example.com \ --subject "Meeting Follow-up" \ --body-html "

    Hi Name,

    Thanks for meeting today. Here are the next steps:

    • Item one
    • Item two

    Best regards,
    Your Name

    " ``` Notes - Set `GOG_ACCOUNT=you@gmail.com` to avoid repeating `--account`. - For scripting, prefer `--json` plus `--no-input`. - Sheets values can be passed via `--values-json` (recommended) or as inline rows. - Docs supports export/cat/copy. In-place edits require a Docs API client (not in gog). - Confirm before sending mail or creating events. - `gog gmail search` returns one row per thread; use `gog gmail messages search` when you need every individual email returned separately.
FILE_NOT_FOUND

content.thinking: Most of these are Facebook notifications. Let me read the actual email content for the substantive ones - the direct emails from Mamiko. Let me also read the existing people file first, then fetch the key emails.

content.text: Let me read the existing file and fetch the actual email contents for the substantive ones (skipping the Facebook notification spam).

# Kanno Mamiko (ËèÖÈáéÁúüÊúõÂ≠ê)

## Basics
- Relationship: Ex-wife, mother of Ryu and Kei
- Birthday: Unknown (over 40 by 2019)
- Met: Before 2018 (lived together in UK)
- Location: Sendai area
- Sister: Me-chan (Âßâ„Å°„ÇÉ„Çì), lives nearby in Sendai, helped with kids regularly

## Context
Ali and Mamiko moved from the UK to Kaigamori, Sendai together with their two sons in July/August 2018. She's Japanese, speaks strong English (TOEIC 890), and was studying further at eikaiwa. Interests include gamelan, Balinese dance, yoga, music, and reading.

They were a functional but strained parenting team. She handled Japanese bureaucracy (banks, kuyakusho, taxes, driving license, insurance, finances). He handled more physical duties (BJJ with Ryu, carrying kids, late-night tantrums). She managed household finances ‚Äî ¬•500-600k/month budget.

### The central tension: Ali's drinking
The LINE chat history (Aug 2018 ‚Äì Jun 2019) shows a repeating pattern: Ali goes out, says he'll be back by midnight, doesn't respond to messages, comes home at 2-4am. She gets anxious, asks where he is, he's either not answering or in a taxi. She once chained the door ‚Äî he slept in the garden. She set a ¬•20,000 bet he wouldn't make it home by 1am. He lost. Her line: "This is only thing I asked you. If you go out, just tell me."

### Intimacy breakdown
Jan 25, 2019: "Couples relationships are not only sex. Just don't push me only your options. Think about how I feel please." She mentioned needing a therapist. Feb 22: "Never ever talk about her with me please" ‚Äî awareness of someone else.

### Her exhaustion
Nosebleeds, headaches, stomach problems, insomnia. Raising two demanding young kids largely alone while Ali was frequently out. Isolated in Sendai ‚Äî sister was only real support. Job hunting was demoralizing (rejected from Tohoku Uni ‚Äî age, gender, work gap).

### Financial stress
Ali fired from Really English April 2019 (didn't know for a month). Large household expenses, tax debt, credit card bills.

### Warm moments
Yakitori orders at Hakkenden/Daikichi, her buying him chocolate eclairs, fashion advice via Safari magazine, mutual language correction, the BJJ taikai where she brought the boys to watch.

## Post-relationship
By April 2024, Ali wrote: "If Mamiko taught me anything it was that you don't have to put up with people that you don't want to spend time with, that don't have your back." Marriage ended at some point. Boys still in Ali's life ‚Äî he's written about wanting to spend more time with them, move closer.

## The children
- **Ryu (Èæç‰πã‰ªã / ËèÖÈáéÈæç‰πã‰ªã)**: Older son. Started elementary school 2019. Separation anxiety, hair-touching habit. Loved Minecraft, Kamen Rider. Started BJJ. Strong fighter. Sometimes grumpy.
- **Kei (ÊÖ∂‰ªã / ËèÖÈáéÊÖ∂‰ªã)**: Younger son, "baby bum." At yochien 2018-2019. Tantrums, poop emergencies, clingy. Sweet when calm. Ate everything.

## Timeline

# spogo / spotify_player

Use `spogo` **(preferred)** for Spotify playback/search. Fall back to `spotify_player` if needed.

Requirements
- Spotify Premium account.
- Either `spogo` or `spotify_player` installed.

spogo setup
- Import cookies: `spogo auth import --browser chrome`

Common CLI commands
- Search: `spogo search track "query"`
- Playback: `spogo play|pause|next|prev`
- Devices: `spogo device list`, `spogo device set "<name|id>"`
- Status: `spogo status`

spotify_player commands (fallback)
- Search: `spotify_player search "query"`
- Playback: `spotify_player playback play|pause|next|previous`
- Connect device: `spotify_player connect`
- Like track: `spotify_player like`

Notes
- Config folder: `~/.config/spotify-player` (e.g., `app.toml`).
- For Spotify Connect integration, set a user `client_id` in config.
- TUI shortcuts are available via `?` in the app.

[WhatsApp +818096291806 +49m 2026-02-01 22:04 GMT+9] Who was the Mongolian general/prince that did the big massacre in samarkand?
[message_id: 3A450A8CE3CB87F9FD4D]

That was **Genghis Khan** himself ‚Äî the sack of Samarkand in 1220. He invaded after the Khwarezmian Shah Muhammad II executed his trade envoys. Samarkand fell in about 5 days despite a garrison of ~100,000. Mass executions followed.

You might also be thinking of the earlier massacre at **Merv** (1221), carried out by Genghis Khan's son **Tolui**, which was even bloodier ‚Äî often cited as one of the deadliest single events in history.

Or if you mean the destruction of **Urgench**, that was **Jochi, Chagatai, and √ñgedei** (Genghis Khan's sons) working together.

Which one were you thinking of?

[WhatsApp +818096291806 +48s 2026-02-01 22:05 GMT+9] Was jochi really a son of the khan?
[message_id: 3A00E4931E02CD73C8CB]

That's *the* question about Jochi ‚Äî and it was a live controversy even during his lifetime.

His mother **B√∂rte** was kidnapped by the Merkits early in her marriage to Tem√ºjin (before he became Genghis Khan). She was held captive for about 8-9 months. Jochi was born shortly after her rescue, so the timing was always suspicious.

Genghis Khan publicly acknowledged Jochi as his firstborn and never disowned him. But his brother **Chagatai** openly called Jochi a "Merkit bastard" ‚Äî famously during the succession debate recorded in *The Secret History of the Mongols*. It nearly came to blows.

The uncertainty poisoned Jochi's position. He was given the most distant lands (the western steppe, which became the Golden Horde), and he and his father were reportedly estranged toward the end ‚Äî Jochi died in 1227, just months before Genghis Khan, and there are rumors Genghis may have been planning to move against him.

Nobody knows for sure. Genghis chose to treat him as legitimate, but the doubt followed Jochi his entire life and shaped the politics of the empire after him.

[WhatsApp +818096291806 +36s 2026-02-01 22:05 GMT+9] Tell me about tsubotai
[message_id: 3A45C15C65B838409E1B]

**Subutai** („Çπ„Éú„Çø„Ç§) ‚Äî arguably the greatest military commander you've never heard of.

Born around 1175, he was a commoner ‚Äî not Mongol royalty, but from the Uriankhai tribe (reindeer people from the forests near Lake Baikal). His family pledged to Tem√ºjin early, and his older brother Jelme was one of Genghis Khan's original companions.

**The record is insane:**
- Directed **20+ campaigns** and won **65+ pitched battles** across his career
- Conquered or overran more territory than any other commander in history ‚Äî from China to Hungary, Korea to Iraq
- Served **three** Great Khans: Genghis, √ñgedei, and briefly G√ºy√ºk

**Key highlights:**

- **The Great Raid (1221-1223):** Genghis sent Subutai and Jebe on a reconnaissance-in-force around the Caspian Sea. They smashed through Georgia, crossed the Caucasus in winter, defeated the Cumans and the Rus' princes at the **Battle of the Kalka River** (1223) ‚Äî Europe's first taste of the Mongols ‚Äî then looped back through the steppe. A 5,000+ km loop through hostile territory, winning every fight.

- **Jin Dynasty campaigns:** Instrumental in breaking northern China.

- **The European invasion (1241):** This is his masterpiece. At around 66 years old, he coordinated a **two-pronged attack** across the Carpathians ‚Äî one army under Batu hit Poland and destroyed a combined European force at **Liegnitz**, while Subutai personally commanded the army that annihilated the Hungarian army at **Mohi**. The two battles happened **two days apart**, hundreds of kilometers from each other. Coordinated by rider relay across mountains. Medieval Europe had absolutely nothing like this.

**What made him special:**
- Master of intelligence gathering ‚Äî he'd spend years mapping enemy territory before invading
- Pioneer of operational-level warfare (coordinating multiple armies across huge distances)
- Used feigned retreats, river diversions, smoke screens, and psychological warfare
- Adapted tactics to every enemy ‚Äî different approach for steppe nomads vs. fortified Chinese cities vs. European heavy cavalry
- Rose entirely on merit, not birth

He retired to his estates around 1248 and died peacefully ‚Äî one of the few great Mongol generals to manage that. The fact that most people know Genghis Khan but not Subutai is one of history's bigger oversights.

James Clavell's Shogun was the entire reason I came to Japan
[message_id: e7ff07f1-2159-446d-8106-65057cf3bc30]

That's a hell of an origin story. Blackthorne washing up on the shores of Japan ‚Üí Ali washing up in Sendai. The pipeline is real.

Clavell is something else ‚Äî Sh≈çgun is one of those books that doesn't just entertain, it rewires how you see an entire culture. Toranaga is one of the best fictional characters ever written. Did you read any of his other Asian Saga books? Tai-Pan, Noble House, King Rat?

Tai Pan and Noble House
[message_id: 80ca0924-35b1-4465-a478-fc604e22fe94]

Tai-Pan is incredible ‚Äî Dirk Struan building Hong Kong from nothing. And Noble House is basically a 1300-page thriller that somehow keeps you gripped the whole time. Clavell had that gift of making business and politics feel as tense as a sword fight.

King Rat is worth picking up if you haven't ‚Äî it's his most personal one, based on his actual time as a POW in Changi prison. Shorter and darker than the others, but raw.

Between Clavell and Iggulden you've got solid taste. Ever read Musashi by Eiji Yoshikawa? Given you came to Japan because of Sh≈çgun, that one might hit different.
